title.value: Social isolation is linked to classical risk factors of Alzheimer’s disease-related dementias
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as provided by the user and it matches the title found in the provided document.
title.quote: Social isolation is linked to classical risk factors of Alzheimer’s disease-related dementias

extractions.description: This paper explores the relationship between social isolation and various classical risk factors associated with Alzheimer’s disease-related dementias (ADRD). Using data from two large-scale population cohorts, the UK Biobank and the Canadian Longitudinal Study on Aging (CLSA), the study investigates subjective loneliness and objective social support in relation to well-established ADRD risk factors. The findings suggest that social isolation is significantly linked to a wide range of dementia risk factors, offering insight for potential preventive measures.

type.justification: The paper involves data analysis from large population cohorts and empirical evidence to support the findings regarding social isolation and Alzheimer’s disease risk factors.
type.quote: Using data from two large-scale population cohorts, the UK Biobank and the Canadian Longitudinal Study on Aging (CLSA), the study investigates subjective loneliness and objective social support in relation to well-established ADRD risk factors.

name.justification: The study focuses on Alzheimer's disease-related dementias, which is a key area within neurology.
name.quote: The premise of our study is that a wider characterization of these social behaviors in late life will enable a more complete conceptualization of ADRD risk, potentially paving the way for novel treatment avenues.

name.justification: The paper employs population-scale assessments to study the associations between social isolation and ADRD risk factors, a common approach in epidemiology.
name.quote: Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias is a major public health burden–compounding over upcoming years due to longevity.

name.justification: The study addresses mental health factors such as depression and personality traits which are relevant to psychiatry.
name.quote: Collectively, mental health factors revealed strong population associations with both subjective and objective social isolation.

name.justification: The UK Biobank is explicitly mentioned as one of the primary sources of data for the study.
name.quote: The UK Biobank is a prospective epidemiological cohort that offers extensive behavioral and demographic assessments in 502,506 participants, recruited from across Great Britain.

referenced_paper_title.value: Sudlow C, Gallacher J, Allen N, Beral V, Burton P, Danesh J, et al. UK biobank: an open access resource for identifying the causes of a wide range of complex diseases of middle and old age. PLoS Med. 2015; 12(3):e1001779.
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the referenced paper for the UK Biobank dataset as noted in the text.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Further information on the consent procedure can be found elsewhere (http://biobank.ctsu.ox.ac.uk/crystal/field.cgi?id=200).

name.justification: The CLSA is explicitly mentioned as one of the primary sources of data for the study.
name.quote: CLSA was launched in 2011 as an independent prospective epidemiological cohort, and places a focus on aging trajectories and deep phenotyping.

referenced_paper_title.value: Raina PS, Wolfson C, Kirkland SA, Griffith LE, Balion C, Cossette B, et al. The Canadian longitudinal study on aging (CLSA). Can J Aging. 2009; 28(3):221–9.
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the referenced paper for the CLSA dataset as noted in the text.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Further information on the consent procedure can be found elsewhere (http://biobank.ctsu.ox.ac.uk/crystal/field.cgi?id=200).

name.justification: The paper mentions the use of PyMC3 for symbolic computation graphs in probabilistic modeling and MCMC sampling.
name.quote: Probabilistic hierarchical modeling and MCMC sampling were implemented as symbolic computation graphs in the PyMC3 framework.

referenced_paper_title.value: Salvatier John, Thomas V. Wiecki, Fonnesbeck C. Probabilistic programming in Python using PyMC3. PeerJ Computer Science. 2016.
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the referenced paper for the PyMC3 library as noted in the text.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Probabilistic programming in Python using PyMC3. PeerJ Computer Science. 2016.

name.justification: The paper mentions the use of Seaborn for generating posterior parameter distribution plots.
name.quote: Posterior parameter distribution plots were generated by Seaborn.

referenced_paper_title.value: Waskom ML. seaborn: statistical data visualization. Journal of Open Source Software, 2021, 6(60), 3021.
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the referenced paper for the Seaborn library as noted in the text.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Posterior parameter distribution plots were generated by Seaborn (https://seaborn.pydata.org/).
